moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3: I think it's called the Vienna game
moves.4. Qh5: Qh7?!! aha... trying a version of Scholar's mate? not quite...
moves.4... Nd6: and we are almost in the middle of the Frankenstein-Dracula -the white bishop is attacked
moves.6. Nb5: deflecting the black knight to prepare for checkmate
moves.8. Qd5: threatening checkmate again... is this crazy or what?
moves.8... Qe7: this might seem like an extremely horrible blunder
moves.9. Nxc7+ Kd8 10. Nxa8: it's not really, though, as you'll soon see
moves.10... b6 11. d3: who cares about a knight? white is behind in development
moves.11... Bb7 12. h4: development and attacking is worth more than saving 1 point with Nb6- white threatens Bg5 and he is going to castle queenside-as you'll see white will develop safely and win
moves.22. g3: if bxh1 Qxh1 threats: Qa8+ and gxh4
moves.22... Nf3: save the knight threat:nxd2 rxd2 bxh1 qxh1 only one threat and black can just deal with Qa8 easily;it's his turn
moves.24. Qh2 Bxh1 25. gxf4: whoa this is really neat if exf4 Qxf4 threats Qb8# and bxf6+
moves.26. fxe5: oh very good! comment your analysis see if you can figure it out:)
